summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/07/13 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Italiano', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Français', 'Italiano', 'Nederlands'], 'Directors': ['Peter Segal'], 'Producers': ['Peter Segal', 'Chris Bender', 'Jake Weiner', 'Robert Simonds', 'Gigi Pritzker', 'Dave Bautista', 'Jonathan Meisner'], 'Starring': ['Dave Bautista', 'Chloe Coleman', 'Ken Jeong'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: Chole Coleman is a god damn, god bloody damn brilliant actress! I'm off to check out the little kid's other movies!
Oh, and this movie? Its a run of the mill spy & civilian surveillance movie and it has all the comic ingredients that made me roll off my sofa on a Sunday afternoon!
Most definitely recommend it! Review Title: Funny, sweet and what the doctor ordered! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/09/14 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Peter Stebbings'], 'Producers': ['Shaftesbury Films', 'South Pacific Pictures'], 'Starring': ['Rachelle Lefevre', 'Matt Whelan', 'Matt Nable'], 'Studio': ['Acorn TV']} Review Text: Apart from a boring storyline that keeps on dragging, the main actress is bad at acting. The character Maggie comes off as self-absorbed doormat who married a rich man child with zero business skills and on whose behalf this apparently highly educated lawyer Maggie keeps making excuses.

Everyone from Maggie's rival, another spoiled druggie to the "journalist" who seem to take her volunteer job a bit too seriously, is super annoying.

In the 4th episode, I was rooting for Mitch the badass lady drug lord and hoping she throws Maggie and her entourage to the ocean and takes over the town.

I am not going to be watching this, especially since the only person I seem to like until now is a ruthless and violently drug lord. Yeah the show is THAT bad! Skip it. Review Title: Main Actress is a spoiled, self-absorbed, door-mat Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/01/02 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'Español', 'Italiano', 'Español [descripción de audio]', '日本語', 'Português', 'Español', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español [CC]', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Marco A. Castillo', 'Adolfo Martínez Pérez', 'Miguel Alcantud', 'Arantxa Echevarría', 'Lucía Valdivieso', 'Manuel Carballo', 'Alberto Ruiz Rojo'], 'Producers': ['Marco A. Castillo', 'Luis Arranz', 'Sara Fernández-Velasco', 'José Velasco'], 'Starring': ['Jaime Lorente', 'Alicia Sanz', 'Francisco Ortiz'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: Wow! This series is incredible. The story of the medieval warlord El Cid and his rise to power in the backdrop of the Spanish & Moors fight for power.
Well done & well-acted.
Can't wait for season 2! Review Title: El Cid - An unexpectedly well done historical series Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Miss Scarlet and the Duke Review Date: 2021/02/15 Categories: Drama Product Description: ["After Eliza Scarlet's father dies of a heart attack, she takes over his private detective business, against the wishes of everyone around her, including family friend Inspector Wellington. Does Eliza have what it takes to be a detective?"] Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ["Declan O'Dwyer"], 'Producers': ["Declan O'Dwyer", 'Richard Tulk-Hart', 'Moreyba Bidessie', 'Patrick Vien', 'Rachael New', 'Todd Berger', 'Patrick Irwin', 'Harvey Myman', 'Jin Ishimoto', 'Patricia Lenahan Ishimoto', 'Larry Bass', 'Susanne Simpson', 'Aaron Farrell'], 'Starring': ['Kate Phillips', 'Stuart Martin', 'Ansu Kabia']} Review Text: The show seems not to know the difference between a woman who is fighting stereotypes in 19 th Century, trying to make a living against all odds, helping and empowering others who she meets and a downright annoying female character with no redeeming quality. Shame because the concept is very refreshing! Review Title: Annoying Female Character & Cliched LGBTQ Characters Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/04/19 Average Rating: 4.1 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'blackface', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'Español (España)', 'Italiano', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', '日本語', 'Português', 'Magyar', 'Deutsch', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Bahasa Melayu', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Nelson Cragg', 'Daniel Stamm', 'Janicza Bravo', 'Craig William Macneill', 'Ti West'], 'Producers': ['Little Marvin', 'David Matthews', 'Roy Lee', 'Miri Yoon', 'Lena Waithe', 'Don Kurt', 'Nelson Cragg', 'Larysa Kondracki', 'Seth Zvi Rosenfeld', 'Dustin Bernard', 'Michael Nelson', 'Brian Wankum'], 'Starring': ['Deborah Ayorinde', 'Ashley Thomas', 'Alison Pill'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: Brilliant, heartbreaking and scary. It had me on the edge of my seat. Review Title: Horrors of American Society Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/07/04 Average Rating: 3.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Richard Huber', 'Dror Zahavi', 'Gregor Schnitzler', 'Franziska Meletzky', 'Dustin Loose', 'Theresa von Eltz', 'Alex Eslam', 'Stephan Wagner', 'Stephan Lacant'], 'Producers': ['Sofie Scherz', 'Andre Naumann', 'Tanja Marzen', 'Nanni Erben', 'Quirin Berg', 'Max Wiedemann'], 'Starring': ['Karin Hanczewski', 'Alwara Hofels', 'Cornelia Groschel']} Review Text: I liked the series. The generational difference is not over the top and is a showcase of mutual respect. It is also surprising humourous. Review Title: Refreshing Detective Series Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/09/19 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Leslie Hope', 'Michelle Ricci', 'Carol Hay'], 'Producers': ['Michelle Ricci', 'Carol Hay', 'Scott Garvie', 'Christina Jennings', 'Cal Coons'], 'Starring': ['Lauren Lee Smith', 'Chantel Riley', 'Rebecca Liddiard']} Review Text: This show feels like a 21st-century show cosplaying an early 20th show in the 21st century. Especially Drake.

Its constantly trying to tick off all the current social issues of our time instead of portraying the period accurately.

This is a poorly made version of the Australian female detective show set in 1920, Australia. It was so good because it wasn't trying to impose 21st-century morality on early 20th century Australia. Review Title: Too Progressive for early 20th century Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/11/20 Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Marc Evans', 'Gareth Bryn', 'Rhys Powys', 'Ed Thomas'], 'Producers': ['Gethin Scourfield', 'Ed Talfan'], 'Starring': ['Eiry Thomas', 'Ifan Huw Dafydd', 'Sara Lloyd-Gregory'], 'Studio': ['Acorn TV']} Review Text: Great acting and fascinating stories.This is set in Wales, which is somewhat rare. Watch it you will not be disappointed Review Title: Loved This Series Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The individual's purchase history underscores a strong preference for engaging, well-acted narratives, particularly those with a mix of humor and drama. High ratings accompanied by enthusiastic reviews reveal a fondness for stories featuring complex characters or historical settings. Ratings fluctuating between 1.0 to 5.0 suggest a nuanced approach to content; the individual appreciates quality performances but has little tolerance for poor storytelling or unlikable characters. 

Common themes include a preference for shows that challenge societal norms and explore human dynamics, with a noticeable distaste for clichés and overly progressive adaptations of historical periods. The reviews indicate that they favor diverse content advisories spanning violence to sexual content, reflecting comfort with mature themes. 

This user also displays price sensitivity, gravitating towards affordable entertainment options and valuing quality without excessive investment. Despite some mixed experiences, they appear loyal to specific genres—dramatic detective stories and historical narratives, particularly those showcasing unique cultural perspectives.

target_interaction.title: Thank you! Thank you!
target_interaction.text:
Tolkien would have loved this homage to his world. So much of love & detail has been poured into his world. Its taken my breath away!
“Still round the corner , there may wait
A new road or a secret gate
And though I oft have passed them by
A day will come at last when I
Shall take the hidden paths that run
West of the Moon, East of the Sun.” - Tolkien
